item.title: GitHub webhook intermittent outage
item.content:encoded:
[High] - GitHub Degradation

GitHub is currently experiencing degradation, causing delays in new deployments triggered from GitHub commits. This may impact a large number of users and is likely caused by a configuration change or issue within the GitHub platform. Summary: Investigating ongoing GitHub degradation, leading to delays in new deployments.

Feb 29, 11:44 UTC
Investigating - GitHub is degraded. New deployments triggered from GitHub commits are delayed until the GitHub incident¹ is resolved.
You can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard² or the Vercel CLI.
¹: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/5lc3f39mjcq8
²: https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/git#creating-a-deployment-from-a-git-reference

item.title: Elevated Build Queue Times
item.content:encoded:
Identified, Node 20, Builds, Queued, Node 18 and below Summary: - The issue with deployments appearing as “QUEUED” has been identified and a fix is in progress. - This issue is only affecting builds using Node 20, with builds using Node 18 and below functioning normally. - The company is currently investigating reports of queued builds and will provide updates as they become available. - Deployments appearing as “QUEUED” have recovered and all new deployments are working as expected. - The incident has been resolved.

Feb 19, 19:56 UTC
Resolved - Deployments appearing as “QUEUED” have recovered, and all new deployments are now working as expected. The incident has been resolved.

Feb 19, 19:13 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is in the works. To note: this issue is only present on builds using Node 20. Builds using Node 18 and below are functioning normally.

Feb 19, 19:01 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating reports of queued builds. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: GitHub Webhook intermittent outage
item.content:encoded:
Identified, Investigating, Delayed, Resolved, Monitoring Summary: GitHub is experiencing an incident that is causing delays in new deployments triggered from GitHub commits. This issue has been identified and is currently being investigated by GitHub. As a workaround, users can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard or the Vercel CLI. At 11:29 UTC, GitHub implemented a fix and the situation is being monitored closely. The incident was resolved at 11:30 UTC, and the platform is now fully operational. Users are encouraged to continue monitoring GitHub's status for any further updates or developments.

Feb 9, 11:30 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 9, 11:29 UTC
Monitoring - GitHub have implemented a fix, we're continuing to monitor this

Feb 9, 11:15 UTC
Identified - GitHub are investigating the issue. We will continue to monitor their status and post updates as they are available

Feb 9, 11:14 UTC
Investigating - New deployments triggered from GitHub commits are delayed until the GitHub incident¹ is resolved.
You can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard² or the Vercel CLI.
¹: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/my7r3l9lsqnk
²: https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/git#creating-a-deployment-from-a-git-reference

item.title: Delayed Log Drains, Build, and Runtime Logs in cle1
item.content:encoded:
Jan 26, 18:30 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 26, 17:30 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 26, 17:00 UTC
Identified - The issue, which began at 15:54 UTC, has been determined to affect customers in the cle1 region. Efforts to resolve the issue are currently underway.

Jan 26, 16:50 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Elevated log drain delivery failures
item.content:encoded:
Jan 25, 16:02 UTC
Resolved - Between 8:40 UTC - 13:55 UTC: users that had the Datadog integration or New Relic integration installed along with the Axiom integration or Sematext integration were affected by log drain delivery failures on Axiom or Sematext.

Log drain deliveries to Datadog and New Relic did not fail during this timeframe.

item.title: Elevated build queue times for Enterprise customers
item.content:encoded:
Jan 21, 09:39 UTC
Resolved - This incident has now been resolved.

Jan 21, 09:27 UTC
Monitoring - We have identified the root cause and have deployed a temporary workaround. This has restored functionality, allowing all pending Enterprise builds to resume. We are continuing to monitor and investigate this issue.

Jan 21, 08:43 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for Enterprise customers. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue, and data from currently queued builds will not be lost. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: Issues accessing new KV stores
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 15:00 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 19, 14:46 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 19, 14:22 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 19, 13:17 UTC
Investigating - We're investigating reports of customers not able to access newly created KV stores. Existing KV stores are working fine.

item.title: Builds with Edge Functions Failing
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 11:55 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 19, 11:02 UTC
Update - Our upstream provider has implemented a fix and are currently monitoring the results. We’ll continue to provide updates on this when they become available.

Jan 19, 10:12 UTC
Monitoring - The issue has been identified by one of our upstream providers and they are actively investigating this. We will share more updates when they become available.

Jan 19, 09:48 UTC
Update - Edge Config updates are also delayed. We are continuing to Investigate this issue.

Jan 19, 09:31 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating failing builds for customers that use Edge Functions. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: Elevated reports of 500 error rates on edge requests
item.content:encoded:
Jan 17, 23:03 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 17, 22:50 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Jan 17, 22:10 UTC
Monitoring - Error rates have returned to a stable state and we are continuing to monitor.

Jan 17, 22:08 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate. The impact is isolated to select regions.

Jan 17, 21:39 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating an elevated number of 500 errors on edge requests.

item.title: Elevated reports of latency and error rates
item.content:encoded:
Jan 16, 14:00 UTC
Resolved - Intermittent errors and high latency were identified at 13:58 UTC and resolved by 14:17 UTC. We are conducting an investigation to determine the root cause and prevent future occurrences.

item.title: Delayed Build Processing
item.content:encoded:
Jan 12, 10:20 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved and all Queued build have recovered.

Jan 12, 10:03 UTC
Monitoring - All new deployments are now working as expected. Deployments appearing as “QUEUED” are starting to recover and should start building soon. We are continuing to monitor this issue.

Jan 12, 09:50 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix has been implemented.

Jan 12, 09:44 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for all customers. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: GitHub webhook intermittent outage
item.content:encoded:
Jan 9, 14:46 UTC
Resolved - All services have recovered and are working as expected.

Jan 9, 14:33 UTC
Monitoring - GitHub have confirmed affected services have been restored and we're monitoring service recovering.

Jan 9, 13:31 UTC
Identified - GitHub is degraded. New deployments triggered from GitHub commits are delayed until the GitHub incident¹ is resolved.
You can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard² or the Vercel CLI.
¹: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/pxg3dz4yg7lp
²: https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/git#creating-a-deployment-from-a-git-reference

item.title: Deployment Creation Errors
item.content:encoded:
Jan 8, 14:07 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 8, 13:39 UTC
Monitoring - Deployments are recovering, we are continuing to monitor their status

Jan 8, 12:08 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating elevated error reports of deployment creation. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: Elevated Latencies Invoking Cross Region Serverless Functions
item.content:encoded:
Jan 4, 20:28 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 4, 19:57 UTC
Monitoring - We have mitigated the core issue and are now monitoring for results.

Jan 4, 19:05 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue that started at 16:56 UTC.

item.title: Elevated error rates when accessing Environment Variables
item.content:encoded:
Jan 3, 13:11 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Affected deployments created between Jan 03, 2024, 10:17 UTC and Jan 03, 2024, 12:56 UTC will need to be redeployed for the fix to apply.

Jan 3, 12:55 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 3, 12:42 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 3, 12:16 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating reports of elevated error rates when accessing Environment Variables. Affected projects can use our Instant Rollback feature to the last known working deployment. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: Speed Insights data not visible in dashboard
item.content:encoded:
Jan 3, 12:56 UTC
Resolved - A fix has been put in place and Speed Insights is now correctly recording data points.

Jan 3, 11:37 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 3, 09:57 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 3, 06:02 UTC
Update - We have found several potential causes and are still determining the true root cause. Please note that this does not appear to affect new projects/deployments. Continuing to investigate

Jan 3, 02:20 UTC
Investigating - We have identified an issue with Speed Insights preventing some customers from seeing data in the dashboard. Currently investigating

item.title: Elevated Dashboard Error Rates
item.content:encoded:
Dec 28, 22:01 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 28, 21:50 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 28, 20:53 UTC
Identified - We have identified the source of the intermittent dashboard errors. A fix will be pushed out as soon as possible.

Dec 28, 20:17 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating reports of intermittent errors on the Vercel Dashboard. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

item.title: Elevated 405 responses for PATCH requests to Middleware
item.content:encoded:
Dec 24, 07:01 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. If you continue to see 405 responses on PATCH requests please redeploy.

Dec 24, 06:27 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 24, 05:59 UTC
Identified - We have identified the root cause. Continuing to work on this.

Dec 24, 05:08 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating reports of elevated 405 responses for PATCH requests to Middleware.

item.title: Elevated OG Image Generation Error Rates
item.content:encoded:
Dec 21, 18:38 UTC
Resolved - A solution has been implemented. For affected users, please redeploy your project(s) to ensure the fix has been properly applied.

Dec 21, 18:04 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Dec 21, 16:51 UTC
Investigating - We have noticed an uptick in OG image-related errors for some users and are currently investigating.

item.title: Elevated reports of INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
item.content:encoded:
Dec 21, 04:34 UTC
Resolved - Intermittent errors of INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR in our Sydney data centre (syd1) were identified at 22:46 UTC on December 20, 2023 (09:46 AEDT on December 21, 2023), and resolved by 23:13 UTC on December 20, 2023 (10:13 AEDT on December 21, 2023).

We are conducting an investigation to determine the root cause and prevent future occurrences.

item.title: Increased Edge Function Invocation Failures in sfo1
item.content:encoded:
Dec 15, 23:15 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 15, 22:04 UTC
Update - We are currently investigating; this appears to have started around 21:34 UTC.

Dec 15, 22:04 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Edge Config Stores failing to load in Vercel UI
item.content:encoded:
Dec 13, 05:35 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 13, 04:56 UTC
Monitoring - At 2023-12-13 01:31 UTC one of the UI components which displays Edge Config Store data within the Vercel UI failed to load. A fix was rolled out at 2023-12-13 04:56 UTC and we are monitoring the results.

item.title: Postgres Performance Degraded
item.content:encoded:
Dec 12, 21:30 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 12, 17:48 UTC
Monitoring - All systems are normal; our upstream provider, Neon, has resolved the issue and their service has now recovered. We are continuing to monitor.

Dec 12, 17:07 UTC
Investigating - Our upstream provider Neon is investigating reports of degraded performance. This affects Postgres database operations in all regions.

The link to the incident via Neon: https://neonstatus.com/incidents/01HHFA8Z7KB52MNQMSDDDFBWM8

item.title: Elevated EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_TIMEOUT Errors
item.content:encoded:
Dec 12, 05:02 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 12, 04:34 UTC
Monitoring - Our upstream provider rolled out a fix. EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_TIMEOUT rates are down. We are continuing to monitor the results.

Dec 12, 03:40 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified. We are working with our upstream provider to resolve this. We will provide updates as soon as they become available.

Dec 12, 03:36 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating elevated EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_TIMEOUT errors. We are working with our upstream provider to resolve this. We will provide updates as soon as they become available.

item.title: Issues accessing new KV stores
item.content:encoded:
Dec 9, 04:34 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 8, 16:50 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 8, 16:01 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Dec 8, 13:53 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Dec 8, 12:46 UTC
Investigating - We're investigating reports of customers not able to access newly created KV stores. Existing KV stores are working fine.

item.title: Elevated TLS handshake times
item.content:encoded:
Dec 7, 17:47 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 7, 17:16 UTC
Monitoring - We are observing increased latencies in performing TLS handshakes in various edge network regions. The team has identified the root cause and is monitoring the resolution.
